docs.snippet: The special House committee on the Benghazi attacks has set a hearing for next Wednesday on efforts to secure embassy facilities, calling two State Department officials as witnesses....
docs.abstract: The special House committee on the Benghazi attacks has set a hearing for next Wednesday on efforts to secure embassy facilities, calling two State Department officials as witnesses.

docs.lead_paragraph: An appeals panel said the court needed time to consider the larger issues surrounding the death sentence of a man whose lawyers say he suffered from schizophrenia for years before killing his in-laws.
docs.snippet: An appeals panel said the court needed time to consider the larger issues surrounding the death sentence of a man whose lawyers say he suffered from schizophrenia for years before killing his in-laws....
docs.abstract: Three-judge panel of United States Court of Appeals in New Orleans stays execution of Texas prisoner Scott Panetti, who shot his wife's parents to death in 1992, saying court needs more time to weigh larger mental health issues in case; Panetti's lawyers argue he suffered from schizophrenia for more than 30 years.

headline.print_headline: Execution Stayed in Case of Mental Illness Claim
headline.main: Execution Stayed in Case of Mental Illness Claim in Texas

docs.lead_paragraph: Buoyed by pressure from the United States, throngs of ordinary Hungarians are fighting back against Prime Minister Viktor Orban's drive to consolidate power through a perceived crackdown on civil liberties.

docs.lead_paragraph: An intensifying foreign policy debate is exposing new divisions among the Republican Party's most ambitious leaders, with high stakes for the 2016 presidential contest and, potentially, the nation's role in global affairs.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nearing a decision on a presidential run in 2016, Jeb Bush on Tuesday reaffirmed his support for the U.S. trade embargo against Cuba and pushed for a foreign policy that he said could help repair the nation's credibility after Barack Obama's presidency.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ms. Lynch, who is awaiting a hearing on her nomination for attorney general, has made past remarks about police relations in minority neighborhoods.
docs.snippet: Ms. Lynch, who is awaiting a hearing on her nomination for attorney general, has made past remarks about police relations in minority neighborhoods....
docs.abstract: Loretta E Lynch, top federal prosecutor in Brooklyn who is awaiting hearing on her nomination to be next attorney general, has made past remarks about 'broken trust' between African-Americans and law enforcement; her comments could put her at odds with some law enforcement groups, who say Obama administration has unfairly cast police in bad light after Ferguson, Mo, police shooting.

headline.print_headline: Nominee’s Past Offers Insight on Race Issues
headline.main: Past Remarks by Loretta Lynch, Attorney General Nominee, Offer Insight on Race Issues

docs.lead_paragraph: Kentucky state law bars candidates from appearing on the ballot for more than one office in the same election. A look at how Republican Sen. Rand Paul might get around that potential roadblock should he decide to add a run for president to his plans, announced Tuesday, to seek a second term in the Senate in 2016:
